reviews.review: It was good but just not the greatest toy story of course, I think it was a better ending for woody for sure, sad it kinda left out buzz a lot and other characters.
I enjoyed the movie and it brought a great nostalgic feel, but I also felt I've watched it already 3 times before

This is the weakest of the series, and feels unfinished somehow.

I felt that the moral centre of this movie was... off: a similar plot to Toy Story 3 in that some toys have sinister motives, but unlike Toy Story 3, it seems like the message here is "the end justify the means". Avoiding spoilers make it difficult to describe, but having characters that behave appallingly "win" because they're somewhat sympathetic is not the message I want to send to youngsters that might watch this movie. There are ways that this could have played out but if the message they're trying to send is "Yeah, sometimes the bad guys win" then mission accomplished.

The movie destroys the character of Woody by demoizing his biggest strength, loyalty, and suddenly makes Buzz into a complete idiot. The plot feels very contrived and is at some points fairly frightening for children. It has no where near the wit, charm, or childhood appeal that the first 3 Toy Stories have. In the end Woody ditches his friends for Bo-peep. Bo-peep is beautifully animated but is a very boring character.
Horror movie, very scary and not appropriate for children of any age.  Avoid!
It's a pretty good story. Just don't understand making sad movies for kids.

Me, as a Toy Story mega-fan, loved this movie. I thought it was a spectacular masterpiece that deserved much more than a 97% 

It's is the first movie in a long time that has brought me to tears.

10/10 Would recommend for anyone.
Where was Jessie?  My kids favorite and was barely in the movie
Conmovedora  y con una calidad impecable.
This film shows that even though we didn't think we needed another Toy Story film but this one proves we did!
